meanings.definition: A person who steals or takes something quickly.
meanings.sent1: The sneaky nabber took the cookie from the jar.
meanings.sent2: The police caught the nabber red-handed with the stolen goods.
meanings.sent3: The little nabber thought he could outsmart everyone with his tricks.
meanings.sent4: The raccoon was a clever nabber, always finding a way into the trash cans.
meanings.sent5: The notorious nabber was finally apprehended after a long chase.

meanings.definition: To catch or seize someone or something suddenly.
meanings.sent1: I tried to nabber the butterfly, but it flew away too fast.
meanings.sent2: The cat tried to nabber the toy mouse as it moved across the floor.
meanings.sent3: The detective decided to nabber the suspect before he could escape.
meanings.sent4: The opportunity to nabber the last piece of cake was too tempting to resist.
meanings.sent5: She managed to nabber a seat on the crowded bus before it filled up.
